quest.name: A Dragon's Resolve
journal: Varshahn stares at the floor despondently.
objectives: Fill the leakproof container with ceruleum at the ceruleum spring.
Deliver the ceruleum-filled tank to the designated location.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If Cagnazzo's intent was for his parting words to give us pause, then he has succeeded.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To embrace death, to find satisfaction in oblivion... Perhaps it is indeed true that many voidsent yearn to return to the Lifestream.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Why does he look so defeated? We are closer to finding his sister, are we not?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The eye explains how they managed to cross over, but we still don't know why they chose this time and this place for an incursion.

dialogue.name: ENGINEER04671
dialogue.text: Looking to head back to Lapis Manalis? Just say the word.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Venture to Lapis Manalis?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: Oh, Azdaja... What has become of you, that even your eye should be so spent of aether...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: I cannot bear the thought of her being held captive a moment longer, but how will I find her? What must I do?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, Vrtra.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I appreciate that you are upset, but such passion clouds your judgment. You must endeavor to remain composed.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: When your mind is clear, we may consider how to proceed with our search.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: <sigh> You are right...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I will help Alphinaud and Alisaie back at the village.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That sounds like a fine idea. We should go as well.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, you've come too.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Leave Vrtra be. He needs time alone with his thoughts.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us take comfort in the knowledge that the voidgate is closed, and that the people of Garlemald need fear the voidsent hordes no longer.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: We're to help Alphinaud and Alisaie, are we? There's little else of interest here, so I wouldn't be opposed to the diversion.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: Pray give me a moment longer.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I don't see Vrtra with you. Is everything all right?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: He needs a moment to himself. While he is indisposed, we thought we'd lend you a hand.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've just finished patrolling the area, so we're fine on that front.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There are no signs of voidsent, and I doubt we'll see any more now that the gate has been closed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As for Alphinaud, he's set his sights on the ceruleum spring. We're hoping to take as much of the stuff as the snowcraft can bear.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That much fuel would keep the people warm for a good while.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We've managed to procure a few suitable containers for transporting the ceruleum, and were about to return to the spring.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: If you've a mind to scrounge up more containers, I can take what you have now and get them filled.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Estinien. The more we can load into the snowcraft, the better.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Would you and Y'shtola mind helping us with our search, then?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You'll need to take any suitable containers to the spring, and then back to the snowcraft once you've filled them with ceruleum.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Any luck finding a container?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hmmm, will this be solid enough?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is a welcome change to have Zero helping of her own volition. Perhaps she is finally beginning to trust us.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This is less a container and more a sieve, given its poor condition and visible holes...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The container appears to be well suited for repurposing. It would be a fine choice for ceruleum storage.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: We just need to carry this liquid fire to the snowcraft? Sounds simple enough.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The container is now filled to the brim with ceruleum.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If that one has been filled, you should hurry and take it to the snowcraft.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Estinien has already seen to the rest.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Go on ahead. The others asked that I remain here in the event they find more.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Good work, my friend. I expect we'll have a sizable load to deliver.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The snowcraft is all but overflowing with ceruleum containers. However, several of your comrades have yet to arrive. Perhaps a nearby vantage point will afford you a more favorable view of their return.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It was good seeing you again. I hope you'll remember to call on us sooner the next time you need help.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Vrtra has quelled the tempest within his heart. He should be fine.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That Azdaja's eye hasn't succumbed to Darkness bespeaks her incredible resilience.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So let us trust in this sign that she yet lives, and be not deterred in our efforts.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I'm not your keeper, nor do I know what you expect of me. But I will keep my word.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: I must apologize for my bout of melancholy. To be so easily shaken ill becomes a great wyrm.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHNBIG
dialogue.text: You have remained at my side and ever offered me support and encouragement. I haven't the words to thank you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I suppose this is where we part ways for now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though we have every faith in you, we will pray for your safety all the same.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm glad we had the chance to talk, Zero. Take care, and till next time!

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Till next time.
